title: 114_s2079
content: The Act is titled the "United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reauthorization Act of 2015". It emphasizes the Commission's role in assessing threats to religious freedom globally and ensuring US efforts to promote religious freedom abroad are effective. The Act extends the Commission's authority until September 30, 2019. In this section, definitions are provided for key terms such as "appropriate congressional committees," "Commission," "Commissioner," and "Vice Chair." These terms are crucial for understanding the roles and structure outlined in the United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reauthorization Act of 2015. The Vice Chair of the Commission is appointed by an elected official from a different political party than the Chair. The Chair and Vice Chair, along with others, conduct a strategic policy and organizational review planning process every two years. The Commission conducts a review of duties, powers, strategic plan actions, annual report, and personnel policies under the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998. The Chair, Vice Chair, and Commissioners aim for unanimous agreement. The Chair, Vice Chair, and Commissioners must ensure unanimous agreement on the strategic policy and organizational review planning process and the strategic plan. If unanimous agreement is not possible, an alternative approval process can be used. The Chair, Vice Chair, and Commissioners must ensure unanimous agreement on the strategic policy and organizational review planning process and the strategic plan. If unanimous agreement is not possible, an alternative approval process can be used. The Commission's strategic plan must be submitted to the appropriate congressional committees every two years, outlining prioritized actions, changes to the annual report, and personnel matters. The Commission's strategic plan must address personnel matters and funding requirements. It may also highlight unresolved issues. The Commission is authorized to implement personnel provisions and annual report requirements outlined in the strategic plan. Congressional oversight allows for inspection of requested information and documents. The Commission must provide documents and testimony to congressional committees as requested. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Amendment to Section 207 of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 for authorization of appropriations. The Commission is authorized to receive $3,500,000 annually from 2016 to 2019 to carry out its provisions. The funds will remain available until expended or until the Commission is terminated. The Commission can only spend the appropriated amounts if it complies with certain requirements. The Freedom Reauthorization Act of 2015 requires the submission of an annual financial report to congressional committees.
